intro: Crudia apalatoa, commonly known as the Apalachee Crudia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and swampy areas. It has elliptical leaves with smooth edges and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds.
